intro: Brownlowia dictyopsila, commonly known as the laceleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with a distinctive veined pattern. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
